channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Samsung posts disappointing third-quarter profit guidance as it grapples with AI chips
item.description: Samsung posts worse-than-expected guidance for third quarter

item.title: Oil Edges Up Amid Middle East Risks, Hurricane Milton
item.description: Oil prices edged higher in early European trade on fears that Hurricane Milton could cause significant supply disruptions in the U.S. and concerns ove...

item.title: PepsiCo trims revenue outlook as North American snacking, key international markets lag
item.description: PepsiCo lowered its full-year outlook for organic revenue but reiterated its forecast for its earnings growth.

item.title: GM expects 2025 earnings to be similar to this year's despite industry headwinds
item.description: The Detroit automaker's targeted adjusted earnings before interest and taxes this year is between $13 billion and $15 billion, or $9.50 and $10.50 per...

item.title: Modelo brewer Constellation falls despite an earnings beat. Here's why we're not concerned
item.description: Constellation Brands on Thursday delivered a solid earnings report and set the stage for an anchor to be raised in the next two quarters.

item.title: As Conflict Spreads, Will Defense Stocks Regain Their Cold War Allure?
item.description: Despite the threat of multipolar competition and a rearmament in Europe, military budgets are far from their 1980s highs.

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company cuts full-year earnings forecast, presses ahead with restructuring
item.description: The news comes as the Japanese retail group resists a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: Gold Demand in China Likely to Improve on 'Rekindled' Sentiment
item.description: Retail demand for gold in China is likely to improve, CCB International said, after sales rebounded 26% on month in August.

item.title: China Stock Rally Shifting Into Phase Two
item.description: The China stock market rally looks set to shift into phase two, featuring slower gains and higher volatility but a renewed focus on earnings and valua...

item.title: Norwegian Krone Looks Likely to Fall, Says Danske Bank
item.description: Danske Bank remains cautious on the Norwegian krone in the near term, preferring to sell the currency on any short-term rallies.
